Sterling: Summary |website=Soccerway |publisher=Perform Group |accessdate=15 May 2018}}</ref> | position = [[Forward (association football)#Winger|Winger]] / [[Midfielder#Attacking midfielder|Attacking midfielder]] | currentclub = [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] | clubnumber = 7 | youthyears1 = 2003–2010 | youthclubs1 = [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]] | youthyears2 = 2010–2012 | youthclubs2 = [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] | years1 = 2012–2015 | clubs1 = [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] | caps1 = 95 | goals1 = 18 | years2 = 2015– | clubs2 = [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] | caps2 = 121 | goals2 = 43 | nationalyears1 = 2009–2010 | nationalteam1 = [[England national under-16 football team|England U16]] | nationalcaps1 = 7 | nationalgoals1 = 1 | nationalyears2 = 2010–2011 | nationalteam2 = [[England national under-17 football team|England U17]] | nationalcaps2 = 13 | nationalgoals2 = 3 | nationalyears3 = 2012 | nationalteam3 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] | nationalcaps3 = 1 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | nationalyears4 = 2012–2013 | nationalteam4 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] | nationalcaps4 = 8 | nationalgoals4 = 3 | nationalyears5 = 2012– | nationalteam5 = [[England national football team|England]] | nationalcaps5 = 47 | nationalgoals5 = 4 | club-update = 23:30, 10 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 22:27, 8 January 2019 (UTC) }} '''Raheem Shaquille Sterling''' (born 8 December 1994) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)#Winger|winger]] and [[Midfielder#Attacking midfielder|attacking midfielder]] for {{English football updater|ManchesC}} club [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] and the [[England national football team|English national team]].
Born in Jamaica, Sterling moved to London at the age of five and began his career at [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]] before signing for [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] in 2010. In July 2015, following a lengthy dispute over a new contract, he was signed by Manchester City in a transfer potentially worth £49 million, the highest transfer fee ever paid for an English player. He then went on to help Manchester City win the Premier League in 2018.
Sterling made his senior debut for England in November 2012 after previously being [[Cap (sport)|capped]] by [[England national youth football team|England youth teams]] at [[England national under-16 football team|under-16]], [[England national under-17 football team|under-17]], [[England national under-19 football team|under-19]] and [[England national under-21 football team|under-21]] levels. He was chosen in [[List of England national football team World Cup and European Championship squads|England's squads]] for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup|2014]] and [[2018 FIFA World Cup]]s and [[UEFA Euro 2016]].
==Early life== Sterling was born in the Maverley district of [[Kingston, Jamaica|Kingston]], Jamaica, and spent his early years there.<ref name="gleaner-2011-02-23">{{cite news |first=André |last=Lowe |title=As Hype Grows Around Raheem Sterling |url=http://jamaica-gleaner.com/gleaner/20110223/sports/sports3.html |newspaper=The Gleaner |location=Kingston |date=23 February 2011 |accessdate=22 April 2011}}</ref><ref name="gleaner-2012-07-01">{{cite news |first=Arthur |last=Hall |title=Maverley's Son Liverpool's Baller Raheem's Return Inspires |url=http://jamaica-gleaner.com/gleaner/20120701/lead/lead3.html |newspaper=The Gleaner |location=Kingston |date=1 July 2012 |accessdate=19 May 2015}}</ref> At the age of five, he emigrated to London with his mother,<ref name="gleaner-2011-02-23"/><ref name="gleaner-2012-07-01"/><ref>{{cite news |last=Smith |first=Ben |title=Raheem Sterling: From school struggles to a class of his own |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/20323590 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=20 August 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Raheem Sterling, England's new wunderkind |url=http://www.channel4.com/news/raheem-sterling-englands-new-wunderkind |publisher=Channel 4 |accessdate=20 August 2016}}</ref> and attended [[Copland Community School|Copland School]] in [[Wembley]], North West London.<ref>{{cite news |last=Wallace |first=Sam |title=Raheem Sterling's already a Wembley legend |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/raheem-sterlings-already-a-wembley-legend-8140062.html |newspaper=The Independent |date=15 September 2012 |accessdate=16 September 2018}}</ref> His absent father was murdered in Jamaica when Sterling was two years old.<ref>{{cite news |title=Raheem Sterling reveals meaning behind new gun tattoo |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2018/05/28/raheem-sterling-reveals-meaning-behind-gun-tattoo/ |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |accessdate=29 May 2018 |date=29 May 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Sanderson |first=David |title=Pride and bafflement as family see Sterling mesmerise a nation |url=http://www.thetimes.co.uk/tto/sport/football/international/article4122310.ece |accessdate=14 December 2014 |newspaper=The Times |location=London |date=18 June 2014}}</ref>
==Club career== ===Liverpool=== ====Early career==== [[File:Raheem Sterling 2011.jpg|thumb|upright|Sterling warming up for [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] in 2011]]
Sterling was signed by [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] from the Academy at [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]] in February 2010 by [[Rafael Benítez]] for an initial fee of £600,000, with the possibility of rising up to £5 million depending on how many appearances he made for the first team.<ref>{{cite news |first=Neil |last=Johnston |title=On the Bench ... With Raheem Sterling, a Winger Catching the Eye at Liverpool |url=http://www.fanhouse.co.uk/2011/02/16/on-the-bench-with-raheem-sterling-a-winger-catching-the-eye/ |website=FanHouse UK |publisher=AOL |date=16 February 2011 |accessdate=22 April 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110220224841/http://www.fanhouse.co.uk/2011/02/16/on-the-bench-with-raheem-sterling-a-winger-catching-the-eye/ |archivedate=20 February 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=10 things you need to know about Raheem Sterling plus video of him in action |url=http://www.mirrorfootball.co.uk/opinion/blogs/mirror-football-blog/Liverpool-starlet-Raheem-Sterling-10-things-you-need-to-know-about-the-wonder-kid-from-QPR-plus-video-of-him-in-action-article217597.html |newspaper=Daily Mirror |location=London |date=16 February 2011 |accessdate=22 April 2011}}</ref>
Sterling played in the [[Liverpool F.C. Reserves and Academy|youth team]], scoring his first goal in a friendly against [[Hibernian F.C.|Hibernian]] in a 2–2 draw. His first [[Premier Academy League]] match was a 2–2 draw against [[Aston Villa F.C. Reserves and Academy|Aston Villa]], his first win coming at home to [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]] a week later. On 15 December, Sterling scored in the [[FA Youth Cup]] in a 4–0 win over [[Notts County F.C.|Notts County]]. On 14 February 2011, Sterling scored five goals in a 9–0 win over [[Southend United F.C.|Southend United]].<ref>{{cite news |first=James |last=Pearson |title=Raheem sterling for Reds' youth |url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,11669_6754489,00.html |publisher=Sky Sports |date=15 February 2011 |accessdate=22 April 2011}}</ref>
On 24 March 2012, Sterling made his senior Liverpool debut as a substitute in a league match against [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]], aged 17 years and 107 days, becoming the third-youngest player to play for the club in the process.<ref>{{cite news |title=Liverpool 1–2 Wigan Athletic |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17412511 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 March 2012 |accessdate=24 March 2012}}</ref> He made two more appearances over the remainder of the campaign, again as a substitute.<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17821974 "Liverpool 0–1 Fulham"]. BBC Sport. 1 May 2012. Retrieved 10 June 2012.</ref><ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17904221 "Liverpool 4–1 Chelsea"]. BBC Sport. 8 May 2012. Retrieved 10 June 2012.</ref>
====2012–13 season==== In August 2012, he made his European debut for the club, coming on as a substitute in a [[UEFA Europa League]] qualifying match against [[FC Gomel|Gomel]], replacing [[Joe Cole]] in a 0–1 away win.<ref>{{cite news |title=Europa League: FC Gomel 0 Liverpool 1 – match report |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |first=Chris |last=Bascombe |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/liverpool/9448093/Europa-League-FC-Gomel-0-Liverpool-1-match-report.html |date=2 August 2012 |accessdate=2 August 2012}}</ref> The following week, Sterling scored his first goal for the senior team with a first-half strike in a friendly against [[Bayer 04 Leverkusen|Bayer Leverkusen]]. On 23 August 2012, he started his first match for Liverpool in a Europa League qualifying match away to [[Heart of Midlothian F.C.|Hearts]] in a 0–1 win.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report/_/id/354329?cc=5739 |title=Own goal gives Reds advantage |date=23 August 2012 |website=ESPN Soccernet |accessdate=23 August 2012}}</ref> He was given his first start in the league three days later in a 2–2 draw at [[Anfield]] to [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]].<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19310450 "Liverpool 2–2 Man City"]. BBC Sport. 26 August 2012. Retrieved 26 August 2012.</ref> He played the full 90 minutes in the loss to [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] on 2 September, and the draw with [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] on 15 September, where he registered one assist and was named man of the match. On 19 September, Sterling was one of the group of teenagers that travelled to Switzerland to play [[BSC Young Boys|Young Boys]] in a UEFA Europa League group match. He replaced [[Stewart Downing]] in the second half as Liverpool won 3–5.<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19582539 "Young Boys 3–5 Liverpool"]. BBC Sport. 20 September 2012. Retrieved 1 October 2012.</ref> On 20 October, Sterling scored his first senior competitive goal for Liverpool in the 29th minute in a 1–0 league win against [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] with a strike from the edge of the box. As a result, he became the second-youngest player ever to score in a competitive fixture for Liverpool, behind only [[Michael Owen]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/latest-news/rodgers-reveals-work-behind-goal |title=Rodgers reveals work behind goal |publisher=Liverpool F.C. |date=20 October 2012 |accessdate=12 May 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140905010538/http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/latest-news/rodgers-reveals-work-behind-goal |archivedate=5 September 2014}}</ref>
On 21 December 2012, Sterling signed a contract extension, committing his future to Liverpool.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/latest-news/sterling-commits-future-to-lfc |title=Sterling commits future to LFC |date=21 December 2012 |accessdate=22 December 2012 |publisher=Liverpool F.C. |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121224005944/http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/latest-news/sterling-commits-future-to-lfc |archivedate=24 December 2012}}</ref> He scored his second league goal for the club on 2 January 2013, opening the scoring in a 3–0 win against Sunderland with a lob over goalkeeper [[Simon Mignolet]].<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20843023 "Liverpool 3–0 Sunderland"]. BBC Sport. 2 January 2013. Retrieved 6 January 2013.</ref>
====2013–14 season==== [[File:Raheem Sterling v PNE.jpg|thumb|upright|Sterling playing for Liverpool in 2013]]
On 27 August 2013, Sterling scored his first goal of the [[2013–14 Liverpool F.C. season|2013–14 season]], the opening goal against Notts County in a 4–2 win in the [[2013–14 Football League Cup|League Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/23764145 |title=Liverpool 4–2 Notts County |date=27 August 2013 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=16 September 2018}}</ref> On 4 December, Sterling scored his first Premier League goal of the season for Liverpool in a 5–1 win over [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]]. His form in December saw him score two further goals in wins against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] (5–0) and [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] (3–1).<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/latest-news/150488-suarez-makes-history-with-norwich-haul |title=Suarez makes history with Norwich haul |date=4 December 2013 |publisher=Liverpool F.C. |accessdate=4 December 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Sanghera |first=Mandeep |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25376976 |title=Liverpool 3–1 Cardiff City |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 December 2013 |accessdate=12 May 2014}}</ref> On 8 February 2014, he scored twice in a 5–1 win against Arsenal at Anfield.<ref>{{cite news |last=McNulty |first=Phil |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25994878 |title=Liverpool 5–1 Arsenal |publisher=BBC Sport |date=8 February 2014 |accessdate=8 February 2014}}</ref> On 13 April, he scored Liverpool's opening goal in a 3–2 win over Manchester City.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/apr/13/liverpool-manchester-city-premier-league-match-report |title=Philippe Coutinho gives Liverpool edge despite Manchester City fightback |date=13 April 2014 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London}}</ref> A week later, he scored two goals and assisted another as Liverpool won 2–3 against Norwich City at [[Carrow Road]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/apr/20/norwich-city-liverpool-premier-league-match-report |title=Raheem Sterling's double gives Liverpool edge over Norwich City |date=20 April 2014 |accessdate=20 April 2014 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London}}</ref>
On 18 April 2014, Sterling was named as one of the six players on the shortlist for the [[PFA Young Player of the Year]] award.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/apr/18/pfa-player-of-the-year-award-shortlist-gerrard-lallana| |title=PFA Player of the Year award shortlist: Gerrard and Lallana nominated |date=18 April 2014 |accessdate=19 April 2014 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London}}</ref> He was named Liverpool Chartered Player of the Month for April.<ref>{{cite web |title=April Player of the Month revealed |url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/162577-april-player-of-the-month-revealed |publisher=Liverpool F.C. |accessdate=21 October 2015}}</ref> At the end of the season, he was named Liverpool's Young Player of the Year.<ref>{{cite web |title=Suarez bags treble at awards dinner |url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/162473-suarez-bags-treble-at-awards-dinner |publisher=Liverpool F.C. |accessdate=21 October 2015}}</ref>
====2014–15 season==== On 17 August 2014, Sterling scored to help Liverpool to win their opening match of the [[2014–15 Liverpool F.C. season|2014–15 season]], a 2–1 win at home to [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] at Anfield.<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28730043 "Liverpool 2–1 Southampton"]. BBC Sport. 17 August 2014. Retrieved 18 August 2014.</ref> On 31 August, Sterling scored the opening goal in a 0–3 league win against Tottenham at [[White Hart Lane]] and was named man of the match.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/28917060 |title=BBC Sport Tottenham Hotspur 0–3 Liverpool |publisher=BBC Sport |date=31 August 2014 |accessdate=31 August 2014}}</ref> Sterling was named the Liverpool Player of the Month for August.<ref>{{cite web |title=Revealed: August's Player of the Month |url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/171238-revealed-august-s-player-of-the-month |publisher=Liverpool F.C. |accessdate=21 October 2015}}</ref>
On 16 September, Sterling made his [[UEFA Champions League]] debut in a 2–1 victory over Bulgarian champions [[PFC Ludogorets Razgrad|Ludogorets Razgrad]] at Anfield.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2015/clubs/player=250024795/index.html |title=Raheem Sterling |accessdate=21 September 2014 |publisher=UEFA}}</ref> On 14 December 2014, he made his 100th appearance for Liverpool in a match against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] at [[Old Trafford]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Manchester United 3 Liverpool 0, match report: David de Gea the Old Trafford hero as rivals are swept aside |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/premier-league/11293000/Manchester-United-3-Liverpool-0-match-report-David-de-Gea-the-Old-Trafford-hero-as-rivals-are-swept-aside.html |accessdate=14 December 2014 |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=14 December 2014}}</ref> On 17 December, Sterling scored a brace in a 1–3 victory over [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|Bournemouth]] at [[Dean Court]] in the [[2014–15 Football League Cup|League Cup]] quarter-final.<ref>{{cite news |last=Henson |first=Mike |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30407773 |title=Bournemouth 1–3 Liverpool |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 December 2014 |accessdate=4 April 2016}}</ref>
On 20 December, Sterling was named as the recipient of the 2014 [[Golden Boy (award)|Golden Boy award]]. "It's down to hard work. I'm really happy that people are recognising that I'm trying to work hard and do my best for this football club. I'm really grateful for this award," he stated upon receiving the award.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/dec/20/liverpool-raheem-sterling-wins-golden-boy-award |title=Liverpool's Raheem Sterling wins Europe's Golden Boy award for 2014 |date=20 December 2014 |accessdate=20 December 2014 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London}}</ref><ref name="Liverpool Echo">{{cite news |title=Raheem Sterling named Europe's Golden Boy after excellent year at Liverpool FC |url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/raheem-sterling-named-europes-golden-8321868 |accessdate=20 December 2014 |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |date=20 December 2014}}</ref> Sterling was officially excused from Liverpool's FA Cup match against [[AFC Wimbledon]] in January 2015, with manager [[Brendan Rodgers]] aiming to prevent the player becoming exhausted. He used the time off to holiday in Jamaica.<ref>{{cite news |title=Raheem Sterling misses Sunderland for Jamaica sun |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30759691 |accessdate=1 February 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=10 January 2015}}</ref>
[[File:Willian Sterling 2015.jpg|thumb|upright|Sterling (right) playing for Liverpool in 2015]]
On 20 January 2015, Sterling scored a fine solo goal against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in a 1–1 draw in the League Cup semi-final first leg at Anfield, going past [[Nemanja Matić]] and [[Gary Cahill]] before beating [[Thibaut Courtois]] to find the net.<ref name=bbc.com>{{cite news |title=Sterling not the finished article |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/32147641 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=21 October 2015}}</ref> On 31 January, Sterling scored the opening goal in a 2–0 win over [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.foxsports.com.au/football/premier-league/premier-league-daniel-sturridge-scores-on-return-as-liverpool-prove-too-strong-for-west-ham/story-e6frf4a3-1227203834165?nk=a236f042cb7d1cab8ff8a84934c51d43 |title=Premier League: Daniel Sturridge scores on return as Liverpool prove too strong for West Ham |date=1 February 2015 |publisher=Fox Sports |accessdate=4 March 2015}}</ref> On 4 February, Sterling scored the equaliser against [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]] at the [[Macron Stadium]] in a 1–2 away win for Liverpool.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/30991161 |title=Bolton Wanderers 1–2 Liverpool |date=4 February 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=5 February 2015}}</ref> On 22 February, he scored the second goal for Liverpool in a 0–2 win over Southampton.<ref>{{cite news |title=Southampton 0–2 Liverpool |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/31476003 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=1 March 2015 |date=22 February 2015}}</ref>
On 13 April, Sterling opened the scoring in a 2–0 win over [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32193540 |title=Liverpool 2–0 Newcastle |publisher=BBC Sport |date=13 April 2015 |accessdate=21 April 2015}}</ref> He was named the team's Young Player of the Season on 19 May for the second consecutive year in a row, and when receiving the award was booed by fans due to his rejection of a new contract;<ref>{{cite news |title=Raheem Sterling wins Liverpool's Young Player of Year award |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32802010 |accessdate=20 May 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=19 May 2015}}</ref> he was also booed on 7 June, while playing for England in [[Dublin]].<ref>{{cite news |last=Bevan |first=Chris |title=England boss Roy Hodgson keeps faith with Raheem Sterling |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33040043 |accessdate=8 June 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 June 2015}}</ref> On 16 April 2015, for the second consecutive year, he was named as one of the six players on the shortlist for the PFA Young Player of the Year award.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.thepfa.com/news/2015/4/16/mens-pfa-young-player-of-the-year-nominees |title=Men's PFA Young Player of the Year: Nominees |date=16 April 2015 |accessdate=12 June 2015 |publisher=Professional Footballers' Association}}</ref>
====Contract dispute==== On 9 February 2015, Brendan Rodgers said that Sterling had been offered "an incredible deal" to stay at Liverpool, rumoured to be a new contract worth £100,000 a week, but he also stated Liverpool were "certainly not a club that is going to give way, way above what a player is worth at a certain time in their career."<ref>{{cite news |last=Kelly |first=Andy |title=Rodgers: Raheem Sterling has been offered 'incredible deal' to stay at Liverpool FC |url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/rodgers-raheem-sterling-been-offered-8608794 |accessdate=10 July 2015 |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |date=9 February 2015}}</ref> However, on 20 March, Rodgers said Sterling's contract situation would not be resolved until the summer at least.<ref>{{cite news |last=Kelly |first=Andy |title=Rodgers:No Liverpool FC deal with Raheem Sterling before the summer – Brendan Rodgers |url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/no-liverpool-fc-deal-raheem-8887385 |accessdate=10 July 2015 |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |date=20 March 2015}}</ref>
On 1 April, Sterling gave an unsanctioned interview with the [[BBC]], where he confirmed he had turned down a new deal, but denied that this was for reasons of money. He had two years of a £35,000 per week contract remaining and said that he would not negotiate a new contract until the end of the season.<ref>{{cite news |last=Pirks |first=Natalie |title=Raheem Sterling: Liverpool forward turns down new deal |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32149613 |accessdate=1 April 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 April 2015}}</ref> Four days later, Brendan Rodgers slammed Sterling's advisors (Aidy Ward) on the interview, saying, "You are not a 20-year-old boy and you pick up the phone and ask to speak to the BBC. You don't do it. Him in particular. But, of course, if he is asked to do that by other parties then that is what he'll do."<ref>{{cite news |title=Brendan Rodgers slams Raheem Sterling's advisers over interview |url=http://www.espnfc.com/liverpool/story/2381200/brendan-rodgers-slams-raheem-sterlings-advisers-over-interview |accessdate=10 July 2015 |website=ESPN FC |date=5 April 2015}}</ref>
On 21 May, amid rumours that Sterling intended to leave the club his agent, Aidy Ward gave an interview to the ''[[London Evening Standard]]'' saying, "I don't care about the PR of the club and the club situation... He is definitely not signing. He's not signing for £700, £800, £900 thousand a week."<ref>{{cite news |last=Moore-Bridger |first=Benedict |title=Raheem Sterling's agent Aidy Ward confirms star wants to leave Liverpool: '£900k-a-week would not keep him at Anfield' |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/raheem-sterlings-agent-aidy-ward-confirms-star-wants-to-leave-liverpool-900000aweek-would-not-keep-him-at-anfield-10266233.html |accessdate=10 July 2015 |newspaper=London Evening Standard |date=21 May 2015}}</ref>
On 11 June, Liverpool reportedly rejected an initial bid of £30 million from Manchester City. One week later, they reportedly rejected a second bid from City for £40 million, with Liverpool valuing Sterling at £50 million.<ref>{{cite news |last=Smith |first=Ben |title=Raheem Sterling: Man City's second bid rejected by Liverpool |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/33161310 |accessdate=10 July 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 June 2015}}</ref> Sterling reportedly later asked to be left out of Liverpool's preseason tour to Asia, and missed two days of training through illness, which was met with widespread criticism from former Liverpool players, including [[Steven Gerrard]], [[Jamie Carragher]] and [[Graeme Souness]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Raheem Sterling: Steven Gerrard 'disappointed' with Liverpool man |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/33473145 |accessdate=10 July 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=10 July 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Souness |first=Graeme |title=Raheem Sterling turning his back on Liverpool |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/29328/9857804/raheem-sterling-turning-his-back-on-liverpool-says-graeme-souness |accessdate=10 July 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 May 2015}}</ref>
===Manchester City=== ====2015–16 season==== [[File:Raheem Sterling (24366304179) (cropped).jpg|thumb|upright|Sterling playing for [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] in 2016]]
On 12 July 2015, a deal was agreed for his transfer to Manchester City for an initial £44 million, with a further potential £5 million in add-ons, subject to personal terms and a medical, which would make him [[List of most expensive association football transfers|one of the most expensive transfers of all time]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33497488 |title=Raheem Sterling: Man City sign Liverpool winger in £49m deal |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 July 2015 |accessdate=4 April 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/man-city-transfers-blues-agree-9640924 |title=Man City transfers: Blues agree £49m Raheem Sterling deal |newspaper=Manchester Evening News |accessdate=4 April 2016}}</ref> On 14 July, Sterling officially joined Manchester City, signing a five-year contract.<ref>{{cite news |title=Raheem Sterling: Man City sign Liverpool winger in £49m deal |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/33497488 |accessdate=14 July 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 July 2015}}</ref> His debut came on 10 August, starting as City began the season with a 0–3 win away to [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]].<ref>{{cite news |title=West Brom 0–3 Man City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33754829 |accessdate=10 August 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=10 August 2015}}</ref> Nineteen days later, Sterling scored his first competitive goal for Manchester City in a 2–0 defeat of [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] at the [[City of Manchester Stadium]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/manchester-city/11834076/Raheem-Sterling-scores-his-first-goal-for-Manchester-City-but-doesnt-want-to-talk-about-it-afterwards.html |title=Raheem Sterling scores his first goal for Manchester City – but doesn't want to talk about it afterwards |date=29 August 2015 |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London}}</ref> Sterling scored his first career hat-trick as City beat Bournemouth 5–1 on 17 October.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/oct/17/manchester-city-bournemouth-premier-league-match-report |title=Manchester City's Raheem Sterling hits hat-trick in rout of Bournemouth |date=17 October 2015 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London}}</ref>
On 3 November, Sterling scored his first UEFA Champions League goal in a 1–3 win away to [[Sevilla FC|Sevilla]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/match-reports/sevilla-1-3-manchester-city-6760510 |title=Sevilla 1–3 Manchester City: Pellegrini's men reach last-16 after Sterling, Fernandinho and Bony goals |date=3 November 2015 |newspaper=Daily Mirror |location=London}}</ref> On 8 December, he scored twice in the final ten minutes of City's last [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League group stage|group stage]] fixture against [[Borussia Mönchengladbach]], helping turn a 1–2 deficit into a 4–2 win and ensuring City overtook [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]] in the final group standings.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34999620 |title=Manchester City 4–2 Borussia Mönchengladbach |date=8 December 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> On 20 March 2016, he suffered a [[Strain (injury)|groin injury]] in a 1–0 loss to [[Manchester derby|rivals]] Manchester United, and was ruled out for 8 weeks.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.com/manchester-city/story/2835554/raheem-sterling-could-miss-rest-of-man-city-season-source |title=Raheem Sterling could miss rest of Manchester City's season – source |website=ESPN FC |accessdate=23 March 2016}}</ref> Sterling eventually lost his place in the starting line-up.<ref name="Manuel Pellegrini explains why Raheem Sterling has been dropped to the bench">{{cite news |title=Manuel Pellegrini explains why Raheem Sterling has been dropped to the bench |url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/raheem-sterling-dropped-manchester-city-11064042 |newspaper=Manchester Evening News |first=James |last=Robson |date=19 March 2016 |accessdate=20 May 2016}}</ref> He failed to feature in any of the most effective performers of the 2015–16 season,<ref name="Premier League 2015-16: The season that defied expectations">{{cite web |title=Premier League 2015–16: The season that defied expectations |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/36255713 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=18 May 2016}}</ref> and was considered one of the worst signings of the season.<ref name="Premier League: Raheem Sterling - The Worst Signing of the Season">{{cite web |title=Premier League: Raheem Sterling – The Worst Signing of the Season |url=https://uk.sports.yahoo.com/news/raheem-sterling-worst-signing-season-125546020.html |publisher=Yahoo Sport |date=18 May 2015}}</ref>
====2016–2018==== Sterling appeared regularly for Manchester City under [[Pep Guardiola]] for the opening matches of the 2016–17 season.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en-us/news/85/england/2016/09/09/27340512/raheems-rebirth-how-pep-has-turned-sterling-into-a-star |title=Raheem's rebirth – how Pep has turned Sterling into a star again |date=9 September 2016 |accessdate=9 September 2016}}</ref> He was [[Premier League Player of the Month]] for August 2016 after he scored two goals and provided one assist in three games.<ref name="premierleague.com">{{Cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/97642 |title=Sterling voted EA SPORTS Player of the Month |accessdate=9 September 2016}}</ref> On 21 February 2017, Sterling scored the opener before setting up a goal for [[Sergio Agüero]] in a 5–3 home win against [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]] in the Champions League.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39030973 |title=Manchester City 5–3 Monaco |date=21 February 2017 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=19 December 2017}}</ref>
On 26 August 2017, Sterling scored the winner in a 2–1 away win away to [[AFC Bournemouth]] in stoppage time. He was sent off by [[Mike Dean (referee)|Mike Dean]] with a second yellow after he celebrated among travelling supporters that had run onto the pitch.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.com/report?gameId=480881 |title=Raheem Sterling strikes late to earn Man City victory at Bournemouth |date=26 August 2017 |website=ESPN FC}}</ref> On 29 November 2017, Sterling scored a 96th minute winner against Southampton in a 2–1 home win.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42075944|title=Manchester City 2–1 Southampton|date=29 November 2017 |publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=23 November 2018}}</ref> He scored his eighteenth and final league goal of the season during a 5–0 victory at Swansea City on 22 April 2018, his most ever at this point in his career.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Sanders |first1=Emma |title=Manchester City 5–0 Swansea City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43772471 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=13 August 2018}}</ref>
====2018–19 season==== Following England's [[2018 FIFA World Cup|World Cup campaign]], Sterling made an immediate return to the Manchester City starting line-up. On 12 August 2018, less than a month after starting in England's 2–0 loss against [[Belgium national football team|Belgium]] in the third place play-off, Sterling scored the opening goal in Manchester City's 2–0 away win against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Arsenal vs. Manchester City 0–2 |url=https://us.soccerway.com/matches/2018/08/12/england/premier-league/arsenal-fc/manchester-city-football-club/2795270/ |accessdate=7 October 2018 |website=Soccerway}}</ref> The strike was Sterling's 50th Premier League goal.<ref>{{cite news |title=Sterling reaches 50 Premier League goals with Arsenal strike|url=https://www.goal.com/en/news/sterling-reaches-50-premier-league-goals-with-arsenal-strike/ulzk24xys3o419nb4wlqita6u|date=12 August 2018|accessdate=23 November 2018 |website=Goal.com}}</ref> On 4 November 2018, Sterling scored twice and made two assists in a 6–1 win against Southampton at home, scoring his 50th goal for Manchester City in all competitions in the process.<ref>{{cite news |title=City 6–1 Southampton: Brief highlights|url=https://www.mancity.com/citytv/match-highlights/2018/november/man-city-southampton-brief-highlights|date=4 November 2018|accessdate=23 November 2018 |publisher=Manchester City F.C.}}</ref> In November 2018, he signed a three-year extension to keep him at City until 2023.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Raheem Sterling: Manchester City forward signs three-year contract extension |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46157225 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 November 2018}}</ref>
In December 2018, Sterling alleged that sections of the media served to "fuel racism" with their portrayal of young black footballers. The comments emerged after Sterling was subjected to alleged racist abuse during City's 2–0 defeat at Chelsea.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/dec/09/raheem-sterling-newspapers-fuelling-racism-alleged-abuse-chelsea|title=Raheem Sterling accuses media of ‘fuelling racism’ after alleged abuse|last=Fifield|first=Dominic|date=9 December 2018|newspaper=The Guardian|access-date=9 December 2018|issn=0261-3077}}</ref>
He started off 2019 with a 2-1 win against Liverpool, where he assisted [[Leroy Sané]]'s winning goal.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.espn.com/soccer/report?gameId=513635 |title=Manchester City vs. Liverpool |work=ESPN |accessdate=27 February 2019}}</ref> On 6 January 2019, he scored a goal and assisted one in a 7-0 win against Rotherham, which booked their place in the fourth round.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.espn.com/soccer/matchstats?gameId=529125 |title=Manchester City vs. Rotherham |work=ESPN |accessdate=27 February 2019}}</ref> On 20 January 2019, he headed a goal to help City win 3-0 over Huddersfield Town.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/46853937 |title=Huddersfield Town vs Manchester City |work=BBC |accessdate=27 February 2019}}</ref> On 3 February 2019, he helped assist 2 of [[Sergio Agüero]]'s goal to beat Arsenal 3-1, which helped City move 2 points behind Liverpool.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/man-city-vs-arsenal/391004 |title=Man City 3-1 Arsenal |work=SkySports |accessdate=27 February 2019}}</ref> On 10 February 2019, he scored 2 goals to beat Chelsea 6-0 at the Etihad.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/man-city-vs-chelsea/391012 |title=Man City 6-0 Chelsea |work=SkySports |accessdate=27 February 2019}}</ref> On 20 February 2019, in a first leg match of the Champions League against Schalke 04, he scored the winning goal in the 90th minute in a 3-2 win.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.espn.com/soccer/report?gameId=530638 |title=Schalke 04 vs. Manchester City |work=ESPN |accessdate=27 February 2019}}</ref> In the Carabao Cup Final on 24 February 2019, he scored the winning penalty in the penalty shootout to win the cup.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.espn.com/soccer/commentary?gameId=535881 |title=Chelsea vs. Manchester City |work=ESPN |accessdate=27 February 2019}}</ref>
==International career== ===Youth teams=== Sterling's international career coincided with the introduction of the "[[Home Nations' gentlemen's agreement|home nations agreement]]." It was not until September 2009 that [[FIFA]] agreed to the proposals by the English, Northern Irish, Scottish and Welsh Football Associations to update the agreement, allowing players who were educated in their nation for five years or more to become eligible for their national team.<ref>{{cite news |title=Driver eligible for Scotland |url=http://www.mirrorfootball.co.uk/news/Driver-eligible-for-Scotland-article185879.html |newspaper=Daily Mirror |location=London |accessdate=6 October 2013 |date=11 October 2009}}</ref> Sterling first represented England at under-16 level in November 2009 in a match against Northern Ireland.<ref>{{cite web |title=Raheem Sterling profile |url=http://www.thefa.com/england/All-Teams/Players/S/Raheem-Sterling |publisher=The Football Association |accessdate=6 October 2013}}</ref> When speaking of the possibility of playing for Jamaica, Sterling said, "When it comes to that decision, that is when I will decide, but if Jamaica calls for me, why not?"<ref name="gleaner-2009-11-11">{{cite news |last=Hall |first=Arthur |title=Jamaican takes UK youth football by storm |newspaper=The Gleaner |location=Kingston |page=1 |date=11 November 2009}}</ref>
Sterling was selected to play for [[England national under-17 football team|England]] for the [[2011 FIFA U-17 World Cup|2011 U-17 World Cup]]. He scored a long-range goal in England's opening 2–0 win against [[Rwanda national under-17 football team|Rwanda]] in [[Pachuca]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/13839092.stm |title=Rwanda beaten by England in World U17 opener |date=20 June 2011 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=21 June 2011}}</ref> He also scored against [[Argentina national under-17 football team|Argentina]] in the second round in a match where England won 4–2 on penalties.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/3270/england-national-team/2011/07/01/2555329/england-under-17s-to-face-germany-in-the-quarter-finals-of |title=England Under-17s to face Germany in the quarter-finals of the World Cup following victory over Argentina on penalties |date=1 July 2011 |publisher=Goal.com |accessdate=14 July 2011}}</ref> On 10 September 2012, Sterling was called up to the senior [[England national football team|England]] squad for the first time for a [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification – UEFA Group H|2014 World Cup qualifying]] match against [[Ukraine national football team|Ukraine]], where he was an unused substitute.<ref>{{cite news |title=Shock England call for trio |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/12098/8069628/Shock-England-call-for-trio |publisher=Sky Sports |date=10 September 2012 |accessdate=10 September 2012}}</ref><ref>[http://www.thefa.com/England/News/match-centre/2012/england-v-ukraine "England 1–1 Ukraine"]. The Football Association. 11 September 2012. Retrieved 1 October 2012.</ref> In early October he was called up for the first time to the [[England national under-21 football team|England under-21]] squad and made his debut as a substitute during a match against Serbia on 16 October.<ref name=u21callup>{{cite news |title=Liverpool winger Raheem Sterling called up to England U21 squad |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19820612 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=3 October 2012}}</ref><ref name=u21debut>{{cite news |title=Serbia U21 0–1 England U21 |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19944974 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=16 October 2012}}</ref> He scored his first goal for England U21 on 13 August 2013, in a 6–0 win against [[Scotland national under-21 football team|Scotland]].<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23690472 "England Under-21s thrash Scotland 6–0 in friendly"]. BBC Sport. 13 August 2013. Retrieved 13 August 2013.</ref>
===Senior team=== [[File:Raheem Sterling 2018-07-14 1.jpg|thumb|upright|Sterling playing for [[England national football team|England]] at the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]]]]
Sterling made his senior debut for England on 14 November 2012, starting in a friendly away to [[Sweden national football team|Sweden]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20306158 |title=Sweden 4–2 England |date=15 November 2012 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=15 November 2012}}</ref> On 5 March 2014, Sterling earned his second cap and was named [[man of the match]] as England beat [[Denmark national football team|Denmark]] 1–0 in a friendly match at [[Wembley Stadium]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.sbs.com.au/news/article/2014/03/06/hodgson-impressed-englands-young-lions |title=Hodgson impressed by England's young lions |date=6 March 2014 |publisher=Special Broadcasting Service}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/jordan-henderson-hails-raheem-sterling-6778138 |title=Henderson hails 'fearless' Sterling after winger's man-of-the-match performance for England |date=6 March 2014 |newspaper=Liverpool Echo}}</ref>
On 12 May 2014, Sterling was named in England's 23-man squad for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/3790/world-cup-2014/2014/05/12/4813050/wilshere-oxlade-chamberlain-in-as-hodgson-names-youthful-england-?ICID=HP_HN_1 |title=Wilshere & Oxlade-Chamberlain in as Hodgson names youthful England 2014 World Cup squad |date=12 May 2014 |accessdate=12 May 2014 |publisher=Goal.com}}</ref> In a pre-tournament friendly on 4 June, against [[Ecuador national football team|Ecuador]] in Miami on his fourth cap, Sterling slid into [[Antonio Valencia]], who reacted by grabbing Sterling's neck; both received red cards for their actions.<ref>{{cite news |title=Raheem Sterling was sent off and Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain suffered a worrying knee injury as England produced a mixed display to draw with Ecuador in their World Cup warm-up game in Miami |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/27383424 |accessdate=4 June 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=4 June 2014 |first=Phil |last=McNulty}}</ref> Valencia later apologised for his reaction.<ref>{{cite news |title=Antonio Valencia 'sorry' after sending off in clash with Raheem Sterling |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/ecuador/10876898/Antonio-Valencia-sorry-after-sending-off-in-clash-with-Raheem-Sterling.html |accessdate=5 June 2014 |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=5 June 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Valencia sorry for grabbing Sterling |url=http://www.espnfc.com/ecuador/story/1862789/antonio-valencia-sorry-for-grabbing-raheem-sterlings-neck |accessdate=5 June 2014 |website=ESPN FC |date=5 June 2014}}</ref> On 14 June, Sterling started in England's opening group match, a 2–1 loss to [[Italy national football team|Italy]] in [[Manaus]], and was rated as the team's best performing player by the BBC.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/27853470 |title=England v Italy: How Roy Hodgson's men rated in Manaus |date=15 June 2014 |accessdate=16 June 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref>
On 27 March 2015, Sterling scored his first senior goal for England in a 4–0 [[UEFA Euro 2016 qualifying|UEFA Euro 2016 qualifier]] against [[Lithuania national football team|Lithuania]] at Wembley Stadium.<ref name="England 4–0 Lithuania">{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/31968091 |title=England 4–0 Lithuania |publisher=BBC Sport |date=27 March 2015 |accessdate=4 April 2016}}</ref> On 9 October 2015, Sterling scored his second goal of the qualifying campaign in a 2–0 victory against [[Estonia national football team|Estonia]], by which point the team were already qualified.<ref name="England 2–0 Estonia">{{cite news |first=Phil |last=McNulty |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/33543936 |title=England 2–0 Estonia |publisher=BBC Sport |date=9 October 2015 |accessdate=4 April 2016}}</ref> He was one of 23 players chosen for the final tournament.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Fifield |first1=Dominic |title=England's Euro 2016 squad: the 23 picked by Roy Hodgson |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/may/16/england-euro-2016-squad-23-picked-roy-hodgson |accessdate=23 September 2017 |newspaper=The Guardian |date=31 May 2016}}</ref>
He was named in the 23-man [[England national football team|England national team]] squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44138600 |title=England World Cup squad: Trent Alexander-Arnold in 23-man squad |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 May 2018 |accessdate=17 May 2018}}</ref>
After a run of 27 games without a goal for England, Sterling scored twice in a [[UEFA Nations League]] group game against [[Spain national football team|Spain]] on 15 October 2018. England went on to win the match 3–2.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Raheem Sterling ends his England goal drought in superb style |first=Jackson |last=Cole |publisher=talkSPORT |date=15 October 2018 |access-date=18 October 2018 |url=https://talksport.com/football/433744/raheem-sterling-ends-goal-drought-england-spain-uefa-nations-league/}}</ref>
==Style of play== Sterling plays as a [[Forward (association football)#Winger|winger]], [[Midfielder#Attacking midfielder|attacking midfielder]] or [[Forward (association football)#Striker|striker]], though he is more comfortable as a natural winger.<ref>[https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/liverpool/11314938/Raheem-Sterling-is-maturing-into-a-proper-striker-at-Liverpool-insists-Brendan-Rodgers.html "Raheem Sterling is maturing into a proper striker at Liverpool, insists Brendan Rodgers"]. ''The Daily Telegraph''. London. Retrieved 11 January 2015</ref><ref>[http://worldsoccertalk.com/2014/12/19/ananlyzing-the-use-of-liverpool-starlet-raheem-sterling-as-the-main-striker/ "Analyzing the use of Liverpool starlet Raheem Sterling as the main striker"]. World Soccer. Retrieved 11 January 2015</ref><ref>[http://www.espnfc.com/liverpool/story/2217608/raheem-sterling-growing-into-elite-strikerbrendan-rodgers-says "Raheem Sterling growing into elite striker, Brendan Rodgers says"]. ''ESPN FC''. Retrieved 11 January 2015.</ref> Sterling has been praised for his adaptability and ability to play wide, at the tip of a midfield diamond and centrally, offering flexibility.<ref name=bbc.com/> Known for his pace, low centre of gravity, and [[Dribbling#Association football|dribbling]] skills,<ref name="Sterling can be as good as Marc Overmars">{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2014/sep/07/raheem-sterling-wayne-rooney-england-switzerland-euro-2016 |title=Raheem Sterling can be as good as Marc Overmars, says Wayne Rooney |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |first=Dominic |last=Fifield |date=7 September 2014 |accessdate=1 March 2016}}</ref> Sterling has been compared to [[Alexis Sánchez]] by his former manager Brendan Rodgers.<ref>{{cite news |title=Raheem Sterling is maturing into a proper striker at Liverpool, insists Brendan Rodgers |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/liverpool/11314938/Raheem-Sterling-is-maturing-into-a-proper-striker-at-Liverpool-insists-Brendan-Rodgers.html |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |accessdate=21 October 2015}}</ref> Rodgers has also praised him for offering a "real threat," his use of pace with composure and his maturity.<ref>{{cite news |title=Raheem Sterling growing into elite striker, Brendan Rodgers says |url=http://www.espnfc.com/liverpool/story/2217608/raheem-sterling-growing-into-elite-strikerbrendan-rodgers-says |website=ESPN FC |accessdate=21 October 2015}}</ref> Despite his small stature, he also possesses considerable upper-body strength, which aids him in withstanding challenges, and retaining possession.<ref name="Sterling can be as good as Marc Overmars"/>
Former [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] midfielder [[Xavi]] said in November 2014 that Sterling is good enough to play for the [[La Liga]] club, praising his physical and technical qualities.<ref>{{cite news |title=Liverpool's Raheem Sterling good enough to play for Barcelona, says Xavi |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/nov/11/liverpool-raheem-sterling-barcelona-xavi |accessdate=15 November 2014 |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=11 November 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Emperors & Empires: Barcelona's Xavi discusses the modern game in exclusive interview |url=http://www.squawka.com/news/emperors-empires-barcelonas-xavi-discusses-the-modern-game/217333 |first=Sanjit |last=Atwal |date=11 November 2014 |accessdate=19 November 2014 |publisher=Squawka News}}</ref> In April 2015, ''[[BBC Sport]]'' columnist Phil McNulty wrote that Sterling was "very good with the potential to be outstanding" but remained a "work in progress" due to inconsistent performances. He also wrote, "He is blessed with natural pace that makes even the best defences and defenders take a step back."<ref>{{cite news |last=McNulty |first=Phil |title=Raheem Sterling is not the finished article at Liverpool |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32147641 |accessdate=1 April 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 April 2015}}</ref>
==Outside football== ===Personal life=== In 2013, citing the influence of his mother, Sterling was quoted as saying he was "not 100 per cent religious but my belief is strong. When the time is right, I will fully be Christian." He added that he put his faith in God and that he prays regularly.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/liverpool-fcs-raheem-sterling-happy-3325424 |title=Liverpool FC's Raheem Sterling happy to keep taking the hits – so long as he's contributing to goals |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |date=22 January 2013 |accessdate=16 September 2018}}</ref> He has one daughter, Melody Rose, born in 2012 after a brief relationship.<ref name="bbc"/>
On 8 August 2013, Sterling was arrested for an alleged common assault on his former girlfriend, a model. He was found not guilty at Liverpool Magistrates Court on 20 September, when the complainant was unable to offer consistent evidence.<ref>{{cite news |first=Jack |last=De Menezes |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/liverpool-winger-raheem-sterling-arrested-on-charge-of-assault-8754230.html |title=Liverpool winger Raheem Sterling arrested on charge of assault |newspaper=The Independent |location=London |date=9 August 2013 |accessdate=12 April 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/sep/20/raheem-sterling-cleared-assault |title=Liverpool's Raheem Sterling cleared of assault on former girlfriend |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=20 September 2013 |accessdate=12 May 2014}}</ref> A few months earlier, on 20 May 2013, a charge of common assault on a different woman was dropped after a witness failed to turn up to court.<ref name="bbc">{{cite news |title=Raheem Sterling: Liverpool winger bids to shed bad boy image |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/26774538 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 March 2014}}</ref>
In April 2015, Sterling was photographed by the ''[[Sunday Mirror]]'' allegedly smoking a [[Hookah|shisha pipe]], and by [[The Sun (United Kingdom)|''The Sun'']] allegedly inhaling [[nitrous oxide]] for recreational purposes. Manager Brendan Rodgers said, "I don't think it is something you should be doing, it's as simple as that...Young players make mistakes. As long as they learn from them, that is what is important."<ref>{{cite news |title=Raheem Sterling: Liverpool star alleged to have taken laughing gas |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32295792 |accessdate=14 April 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 April 2015}}</ref>
In June 2017 following the [[Grenfell Tower fire]] in which 71 people died, Sterling made a "substantial" donation to those affected by the fire.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Ornstein |first=David |title=Grenfell Tower fire: Man City winger Raheem Sterling to make donation |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40297310 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 June 2017 |accessdate=22 August 2018}}</ref>
On 16 December 2017, Sterling was attacked outside Manchester City's training ground by a man who used racist language towards him. Four days later, 29-year-old Karl Anderson, a convicted football hooligan, pleaded guilty to racially aggravated common assault and was sentenced to 16 weeks in prison and a £100 fine.<ref>{{cite news |title=Raheem Sterling: hooligan admits racially aggravated attack on Man City winger |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42429178 |accessdate=20 December 2017 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 December 2017}}</ref> ''The Guardian'' praised Sterling's resilience and courage in deciding to play only four hours afterwards.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2017/dec/22/why-we-should-take-our-hats-off-to-raheem-sterling |title=Abuse of easy target Raheem Sterling leaves bitter taste in mouth |newspaper=The Guardian |author=Barney Ronay |date=22 December 2017 |accessdate=22 December 2017}}</ref>
Sterling has an [[M16 rifle]] tattooed on his leg. He received criticism from anti-violence groups but said that the tattoo had deeper meaning and referred to his father who was killed when Sterling was two years old.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-44285455 |title=England striker defends gun tattoo |date=29 May 2018 |publisher=BBC News}}</ref>
The treatment of Sterling by Britain's tabloid media, especially ''The Sun'', has been deemed unfair and racist by pundits including [[Ian Wright]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Raheem Sterling: Manchester City winger is targeted by racism, says Ian Wright |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45177178 |accessdate=13 August 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=13 August 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Mcleod |first1=Maurice |title=As Raheem Sterling knows, successful black men have targets on their back |url=https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/may/30/raheem-sterling-media-young-black-men-footballer-tattoo |accessdate=13 August 2018 |newspaper=The Guardian |date=30 May 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Stopes |first1=Harry |title=The Press v. Raheem Sterling |url=https://www.lrb.co.uk/blog/2018/07/06/harry-stopes/the-press-v-raheem-sterling/ |accessdate=13 August 2018 |website=London Review of Books |date=6 July 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Mediawatch special: Sterling, The Sun and racist attacks |url=https://www.football365.com/news/mediawatch-special-raheem-sterling-the-sun-and-racist-attacks |accessdate=13 August 2018 |publisher=Football 365 |date=29 May 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |author1=Media Mole |title="Disgraceful and borderline racist": the Sun takes issue with Raheem Sterling, yet again |url=https://www.newstatesman.com/politics/sport/2018/05/disgraceful-and-borderline-racist-sun-takes-issue-raheem-sterling-yet-again |accessdate=13 August 2018 |website=New Statesman |date=29 May 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Adoo |first1=Edward |title=Let's be honest: we wouldn't draw a natural connection between Raheem Sterling's tattoo and gang violence if he was white |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/voices/raheem-sterling-gun-tattoo-gang-violence-white-race-england-football-a8375346.html |accessdate=13 August 2018 |newspaper=The Independent |date=30 May 2018}}</ref>
===Sponsorship=== In 2012, Sterling signed a sponsorship deal with American sportswear and equipment supplier, [[Nike, Inc.|Nike]]. He appeared in an advert for the new Nike Green Speed II alongside [[Mario Götze]], [[Theo Walcott]], [[Eden Hazard]], [[Christian Eriksen]] and [[Stephan El Shaarawy]] in November 2012.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.footballboots.co.uk/7951-liverpools-raheem-sterling-wears-the-nike-gs2.html |title=Raheem Sterling Wears the Nike GS2 |publisher=Football Boots |accessdate=26 November 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.footballboots.co.uk/nike-gs.html |title=Nike GS2 Football Boots |website=FootballBoots.co.uk |accessdate=26 November 2012}}</ref> In January 2013, he modelled the new [[Nike Mercurial Vapor]] IX.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RpHaaLJs1QY |title=Nike Mercurial Vapor IX – Raheem Sterling |via=YouTube |publisher=Copa90 |date=17 January 2013 |accessdate=16 September 2018}}</ref>
